Event.0: "Diagnosis Murder" actor Dick Van Dyke (86) weds make-up artist Arlene Silver (40) in Malibu
Event.1: The Return of the King—the last installment in the film adaptation of J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy The Lord of the Rings—received 11 Academy Awards, tying the record held by Ben-Hur (1959) and Titanic (1997).
Event.2: Fashion designer Nicole Miller (44) weds Kim Taipale (42) in the office of New York City Mayor Rudolph Giuliani
Event.3:
Voting begun on Bosnian independence
Beginning this day in 1992, the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina held a referendum on independence that won almost unanimous support, and on March 3 independence was proclaimed, prompting shelling by Serbian forces.
Event.4: Pierre Trudeau announces he is stepping down after 15 years as Canadian Prime Minister
Event.5: Gordie Howe becomes 1st NHL player to score 800 career goals
Event.6: Beatles' "Sgt Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band" wins Grammy Award for Album of the Year, the first rock LP to do so
Event.7: Agadir earthquake in Morocco kills a third of the population (12,000-15,000)
Event.9:
Aileen Wuornos
American serial killer
was born
Event.10:
Dennis Farina
American actor
was born
Event.11: Hattie McDaniel becomes 1st African American woman to win an Oscar for "Gone with the Wind"
Event.12: A new, democratic constitution was adopted by the National Assembly elected by Czech and Slovak leaders, furthering the consolidation of the two states into Czechoslovakia.
Event.13: Theodore Roosevelt, appoints 7-man Panama Canal Commission to proceed with completing a canal at the Isthmus
Event.14: Jimmy Dorsey, whose orchestra was one of the most popular big bands of the swing era in the United States, was born.
Event.15: Indian politician Morarji Desai—who, as prime minister of India (1977–79), was the first leader of sovereign India not to represent the long-ruling Indian National Congress party—was born.
Event.16:
Morarji Desai
prime minister of India
was born
Event.17: Dutch (King) Willem II marries Russian grand-duchess Anna Paulowna
Event.18: The Confederation of Bar was organized to defend the privileges of the Roman Catholic Church and the independence of Poland against Russian encroachment.
Event.19: Ann Lee (“Mother Ann”), the religious leader who brought the Shaker sect from England to the American colonies, was born in Manchester, England.
Event.20: The town of Deerfield, Massachusetts, was razed in the bloodiest battle of Queen Anne's War.
Event.21: First people are accused of witchcraft in Salem Massachusetts - Sarah Good, Sarah Osborne and Tituba, a West Indian slave
